Reviews.Title: “a budget week en in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: nadia g
Reviews.Content: I was with my sister in Montreal in march 30 th and this hotel was a good price for value. Our studio was clean and spacious with a kitchen.Our bed was confortable and we had a quiet and nice stay.The breakfast is affordable and served between 8-11 Am. Place Alexis Nihon a shooping center closed by is perfect to buy take away such as sushis, and sandwitches .If you look for a good deal this hotel is perfect.I pay 79 $ a night !

Reviews.Title: “Stay somewhere else - do yourself a favour.”
Reviews.Author: Stix2002
Reviews.Content: This place was an apartment building which makes the rooms spacious however it is a dump. There are no amenities other than an old pool, a sauna that doesn't work and a beat up exercise room. You can't even get any ice. The rooms are old and run down. Everywhere you look there are things in need of repair or that have been repaired in a half assed manner. Absolutely brutal and the second worst place I have ever paid money to stay.

Reviews.Title: “they cancelled our reservation”
Reviews.Author: jamie321
Reviews.Content: booked a two night stay through expedia, prepaid. due to our flight being delayed we arrived late. due to us arriving late the hotel cancelled our entire reservation and would not offer us a refund or to reinstate the prepaid booking. therefore did not get to experience the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again!”
Reviews.Content: I try to keep an open mind about hotels untill I see the whole thing but it was hard to stay open minded when as soon as you walk in the room, you need to call down for clean towels and sheets because they are covered in hair and well..... I wasnt expecting much because of the price but the service did not make up for the dirt in the rooms. Took 3hrs to get clean towels and the staff were not pleased when you came down to ask questions and were down right snotty. The location on this hotel was awesome, nice bars close by and only blocks away from Crescent street and St Catherine St. Would not recommend this hotel for human occupation and the best part of the vacation is when I got home and could have a hot shower in a nice clean washroom...

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 or 5 star Hotel but the best place to stay in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: naxos0714
Reviews.Content: I can not say enough kind things about this hotel and its staff. If you are looking for a 4 or 5 star hotel and spa move on this is not what you want and you will not be happy. If you want a nice apartment to stay in this is the place for you. I would highly recommend renting a 1 bedroom as they are much nicer than the studios. I used to travel for work and I dislike the traditional room with bed. (including 5 star) You can go to the PA Market(1418 Du Fort) or IGA (in the Mall) and pick up a few groceries. (A soda tastes much better at 50 cents a can than $4.00 out of a mini-fridge) The hotel is centrally located just off busy St. Catherine. The Atwater Metro and AMC22 (AMC theaters) and Place Alexis Nihon (Mall) are all about about a 3 minute walk away. If you have a problem please let the staff know and as far as my experiences any problem will be resolved to the best of their abillities. The rooms that have been renovated are nice. When booking if possible ask for a renovated room. The rooms not yet renovated are a little worn but still nice. The only complaint I have is that the pool is very small though they do have an outside sunning area. For the price it's a bargin. The neighborhood is safe I have been staying here for years and never had a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Reflects the price...cheap and dirty!”
Reviews.Author: Soulia
Reviews.Content: Was attracted to the quality/price (bi-level suite in downtown Mtl for less than $70), it was awful. Very dirty carpets, old furniture, in desperate need of renovations, smelled really bad, A/C not working and when did work after a service call, did not supply enough cold air to vent the room, very slow and tiny elevators (2 only), no parking available, extremely dirty pool area with some kind of carpet all around, no access to rooftop terrasse as stated, bi-level suite = 2 stairs to go to room area, bathroom was dirty and moldy. Happy that it was only 1 night because I would not have stayed there. Kitchennette seemed ok, did not used it. Very good location and near metro stop.

Reviews.Title: “Should have trusted the other reviews--Don't stay here!”
Reviews.Author: averagejoe75
Reviews.Content: I've been a member of this board long enough to know that when the majority of reviews are negative on a property, you shouldn't stay there. I didn't heed that advice this time around. I had to make a 3 night booking for Downtown Montreal for some meetings, and felt I was getting such a good price for a suite hotel in that city, that I grabbed it from booking.com. I just couldn't pass it up. My mistake. I arrived at the hotel at about 9pm. There is no immediate place to park the car, as the streets are all full. So I called the front desk, and they informed me that the hotel parking lot was full, and I would have to park at the Pepsi Forum across the street. Ok, I'll let that one slip. When I finally get to the hotel, I get the sense that this is some old age pensioner's place, or something from Vancouver's downtown east side for the homeless. The check-in staff were friendly enough--gave me a room and sent me on my way. The building inside and outside looks like it's from the 70s. The relic of an elevator took 5 mins to respond to the call button, despite being empty. As soon as I approached the door to the room, I could smell something nasty. I opened the door and was floored. The place stunk--reeked--of I don't know what. It was pervasive throughout the entire living room, kitchen, bedroom and toilet. I opened all the doors and windows and turned the a/c to full and went outside to have dinner. An hour later I returned to find absolutely no change. I went to the front desk, told them of the situation and they gave me another room on a lower floor. Hesitantly, I opened the door and was pleased to find no smell. However the room was identical to the previous one. Let me just say this, not once did I walk barefoot in that room, not even with socks on--I kept my shoes on the entire time. The carpet was filthy. On one area under the bed, there appeared to be a large glob of what looked like rat feces. There was dust everywhere. All the furnishings are about 30 years old or older, and they looked like it. I didn't dare sit on the couch in the living room, it was covered with a fine layer of dirt. I went on the balcony and immediately came inside again--it was horrendous. Paint peeling off everywhere, cigarette butts on the ground, big dark bltoches all over the place. In the room, there were enormous stains all over the walls and the carpets and sofa. The kitchen was a joke. All though there was a fridge and a stove and some basic accessories, I didn't dare use anything. The bathroom was tiny, but it was clean i'll give it that much. But it looked like it belonged in a urban Detroit 2 bedroom home slated for demolition. You can imagine the beds weren't much better. As soon as I lifted the mattress, I could see the bed bugs with my own eyes everywhere. I stayed one night, and despite having prepaid for three, left the next day and checked into the Holiday Inn Express--same price but a world apart. Let me say this--I travel all over the world, stay about 100 nights a year in hotels. I stay at major properties like Fairmont, Intercontinentals, etc, and smaller dives in places like Delhi and Bangkok. I am definitely not a very picky person. I can appreciate some properties are simply older, but are well kept. I can appreciate some properties are simply cheaper or budget. But this place should not exist as a hotel. It should have been demolished 10 years ago. I know extreme reviews are usually not reliable, but take it from me--avoid this place at all costs. You've been warned.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but good value”
Reviews.Author: Drummond89
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent facility for a short cheap stay downtown Montreal. It appears to have been a apartment building that was converted into a hotel. In consequence, there is always a long wait for the elevator which is often already packed. The breakfast accommodation is also quite substandard, but there are lot of restaurants nearby and the apartments have full cooking. On the plus, these are great little apartments with full facilities. It is only a block from hockey and the Alexis Nihon.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected”
Reviews.Author: D M
Reviews.Content: It is an old apartment building, transformed into a hotel. Bad smell in the room, old carpet, old bathroom, old kitchen, old elevators and only 2 of them, no parking spots. Overall it was clean, they try to make it clean, but the old furniture, carpet, sofa, closets a.s.o. gives you a bad feeling. I wouldn't stay there again. I think for this money you can find a better place. You have to pay for your stay when checking in instead of checking out. What kind of hotel charges you when you get there, instead of when you are leaving. This should tell you something about the customers they had in the past.

Reviews.Title: “Poor treatment after 20 years of staying att the Belevedere.”
Reviews.Author: Carole F
Reviews.Content: Our suite, for which we paid top dollar since no discounts were available, had two huge holes in the walls, burns on the counter in the kitchen, a lamp with a shade that had to be propped up against the wall, no coffee table, and the furniture in the bathroom was showing signs of swelling and warping from the dampness. It was a refurbished suite but, apparently, hadn't been checked by the management for some time, since they were unaware of the problems until I told them about it after our first night there. I was offered another suite but it would ot be available for yet another day. Since it was tolerable, and we were already unpacked and settled in, we said we'd put up with it. When I requested an adjustment in the price (after two weeks of trying to contact the manager) I was told it was not possible since I had been offered another suite.

Reviews.Title: “Warning bedbugs”
Reviews.Author: Lingardia
Reviews.Content: Got there late at night it was a fast and simple check in. Went to my room. And was shocked I paid for a 1 br but got a full suit. But it was like a run down apartment crappy pink paint on the walls. Furniture felt like a handmedown 4 times as it was nicer to sit on the floor. Although those carpets really are nasty. It seemed averagely clean. Found a beer can on my deck. It had holes in the walls and im quite sure it's only one step up From a rent By the hour hotel. If u want a cozy get away this is not for u. If your traveling hippy who's really not fussy about your room then this is up Ur ally. However I just realized I brought bed bugs home with me Soooo not very clean at all!!!

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and clean but old, and needing huge renovation”
Reviews.Author: mariel278
Reviews.Content: We stayed there at the beginning of July during the Jazz Festival. We got an amazingly low price of $200 for ou family of 5 (2 adults and 3 teeagers) for two nights! And we got wat we paid for : a shabby kind of suite with a separate bedroom furnished with two double beds, a living room with a sofa bed, a small kitchen and a mini bathroom. Everything was old (must get back to the 60s-70s as well as the photos on the website) and in a very poor condition but everything was clean. The lifts are really sloooow which is quite annoying, we used the stairs a lot because we were luckily on the 6th floor. Imagine how it is when you're on the 19th... The neighbourhood was quiet and, though we walked a lot even at night, we never felt insecure. It's not ideally situated even though we walked most of the time. Nevertheless, if you want to stay in Montreal at a very good price and you don't need a fancy place, it's for you. As for us, we won't stay there anymore.

Reviews.Title: “Overall not terrible but wouldnt stay again”
Reviews.Author: juliasochi86
Reviews.Content: MY Bf and I stayed at this hotel over night. People at front desk were pleasant and check in was very fast. We stayed on the 12th floor. There was a balcony in our room but the view was not pleasant since roofs of other buildings were everywhere you looked. The room was spacious with old furniture and a small kitchen with stove and fridge. This hotel is good for families who are on budget and choose to cook. All I can say is that the next night we stayed at a different hotel with 4 stars and it was so much better and luxurious. I personally would not go back to this hotel ever again. TOO OLD

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised!!!”
Reviews.Author: dcostam
Reviews.Content: My husband and daughter and I ventured out to Montreal to visit family, who recently were located from Vancouver to Montreal. They are living in temporary accomodations, and so we thought we'd get a hotel room to save them headache, and work. I booked this hotel and the reviews weren't fantastic, but I thought for the price, and for the amount of time we would be in the actual room, it would be ok. Well, we checked in...with no hassles. Our room was ready. It was spotless. It was clean, it even had a kitchen, which would be great for anyone with young kids. The facilities were clean too, like the pool etc. The location was top notch. We really enjoyed our stay here. Our only complaint was the elevator was too slow, and the cleaning staff hog the elevators (only 2) with their usage. There should be a service elevator for hotel staff, I believe. They held it up so guests had to wait and take the next elevator. We let 4 elevators go...before we could get on, and then it stopped on every floor, because now, there was a backlog of guests to be transported to the lobby. I was not impressed with that. But if you're not in a huge rush...then this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best places to stay in Montreal!”
Reviews.Author: naxos0714
Reviews.Content: We have stayed numerous times at this location. Its a great location just off busy St Catherine St. The AMC 22 is just a few feet away. The staff is always helpful and courteous. I used to travel for business and I like the apartment like feel (kitchen/lving room/bedroom) much nicer than the usual hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “Shabby but Functional”
Reviews.Author: DadhitstheRoad
Reviews.Content: My two teenage sons and I wanted to stay in one room so this hotel offered a one bedroom suite with a sofa bed in the living room. The room was clean, and functional but old and worn looking. There was no TV in the bedroom and the one in the Living room was a 21" tube model but it worked. The kitchen and bathroom were likewise. The location was fine. Two blocks from a Mall, Cinema, St. Catherine and a Metro stop. Once the weather improved we took used the Bixi bikes rentals to get around town and it was great. I wouldn't bring my wife and younger daughter here but for me and my boys it was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive for what you get”
Reviews.Author: smiler70
Reviews.Content: Low budget hotel with high budget prices . Watch out for add Ons . Was 210 when we left it was 315 Very poor

Reviews.Title: “Scary, dirty and old!”
Reviews.Author: followmearound
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel a few times, not by choice. You can't open the windows or the balcony doors because the smell of drugs is SO strong. There are vagrants all over the place and garbage strewn everywhere. Staff are rude and uninterested; they are bothered if you have any questions or requests. The entire building stinks. The carpets are worn, the paint is peeling off in huge pieces and on the weekend, hookers wander the halls. To add to all of this, people would bang on our door at all hours at night. The pictures they show of this hotel always have lights on so you can't see how filthy it is. NEVER AGAIN!! I regret not taking any photos to show you what it's really like!

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: quincy
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night with spouse and teenaged son, so liked the fact that it was apartment style and son had a separate room. The location was very convenient. and there were lots of interesting restaurants near by on Ste. Catherine St. My only complaint is with the service. The TV remote control was not working - it needed new batteries. We asked the front desk to fix it and they promised to send someone with batteries, but they never materialized.

Reviews.Title: “We really enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: shirleyboni
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with our room. It was very clean and the kitchenette was well stocked with all the basics. The bed and bedding was comfortable and the studio room was spacious. The toiletries were simple but very adequate. The appliances all worked nicley except for the bathroom fan. The location is excellent, very close to the subway and the supermarket and restaurants. The area is not upscale and a few of the surrounding blocks are a bit run-down, but we didn't ever feel unsafe because we stayed aware of our surroundings. The main street - St. Catherines is a block away and the Atwater Market is in walking distance. There is a breakfast room in the hotel which serves a buffet breakfast for an additional 7.99, with coffee, juice, cereal, fruit, scrambled eggs and bacon or sausage and toast. It isn't gourmet but it works if needed. The lobby is unimpressive but it provides a comfortable waiting area and it is well looked after. We did not receive any maid service for the first three days of our stay. Nobody removed the garbage or made our bed. We eventually complained at the front desk and we received service every day from then on, although the coffee and the powdered milk supply was never refilled. The staff at the front desk were very pleasant and gave us directions when we asked for them. They very kindly agreed to store our luggage after we checked out at noon because our flight wasn't until the evening. All in all, we were very satisfied with our stay and we would definitely go back,

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your time here...”
Reviews.Author: Revere2339446
Reviews.Content: I went to this place for the first time, due to the lower price compared to the Marriott Residence Inn. It is in the same area, Westmount, which is a greal location in Montreal. Other than the location, this place is brutal. Staff was rude, and knew nothing of the area when asked. Parking is limited, and was not available when checked in. Room had peeling paint, and broken lights. Essentially don't waste your time going here.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: blues911_7
Reviews.Content: While this hotel has not received many reviews in the past, I chose this location in large part to it's close proximity to a nearby university where my step-son was enrolling in first year. Not being familiar with the city, we wanted to be nearby. It's location is certainly within a busy downtown area, our night was restful with no complaints of loud noises. While the building is older, our room was found to be spacious, comfortable and quite clean. There was a fully equipped kitchen & dining area that we did not use, the Living Room was nice & comfortable. The bedroom had (2) double beds and while a queen sixze bed would have been preferred, you could say that the room was more accomodating for 3 - 4 people (with a pullout couch in the Living Room). There is an optional $7.99 breakfast which was ok. Parking like many hotels is extra. Would we stay here again? Yes, most certainly. The price, location, cleanliness & space available are the deciding factors.

Reviews.Title: “Good value basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Luitzen
Reviews.Content: The room was large, pleasant and clean. It had a sofa and separate small kitchen and bathroom. Air conditioning worked, but was noisy (window unit). Excellent value breakfast buffet (bacon, eggs, tinned fruit, yogourt etc). 10 minutes walk from downtown shopping area. Large mall nearby. Problems: desk light broken (reported, but never fixed); very slow internet; sink leaked onto floor.

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended”
Reviews.Author: World_Citizen8
Reviews.Content: This would rank among my 10 worst hotels. This place looks like an old apartment building converted into a hotel. My room was large with a kitchen, lounge, and bedroom. The bathroom was in desperate need of repairs with faucet leaking and tiles cracked. The carpet was old and faded. One lamp was broken and was not replaced in spite of several requests. The elevators had seen better days. They had a small self-service laundry room but I never managed to wash my clothes -- the few machines were absolutely always busy (or broken). You also had to insert a lot of coins but they had no machine to change bank notes. Service was very casual. As this is not really a hotel there are no dining facilities on-site. Not recommended.

Reviews.Title: “very nice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in the summer. The staff was very helpful, the room spacious and clean and the location excellent. We used the pool daily (although it was a little cold). We would gladly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a week in Montreal. We had originally booked into another hotel which we ended up leaving after one night due to our dissatisfaction with our room. We moved to La Tour Belvedere for the remainder of our vacation. This hotel provides excellent value for your money. I am surprised by the other reviews as our experience was not at all the same. Maybe our expectations were more moderate. We expected friendly staff, a well maintained facility and our rooms to be clean and comfortable. La Tour Belvedere provided all of this. We stayed in a one bedroom suite which consisted of a living room, eating area, a small but efficient kitchen, a separate bedroom with two double beds and a small but clean bathroom. There was daily maid service with the towels, shampoo and soap refreshed daily. For the rates charged at this hotel we did not expect a concierge, room service, restaurant, bar, meeting rooms, etc. It is located within a two minute walk of the Atwater metro station and is an easy walk to the Crescent Street tourist area, It is situated in a residential area which we liked as it made us feel more like one of the locals rather than a tourist. There are a number of very good restaurants within a five minute walk in all directions. I would definitely stay here again and will recommend it to others looking for a moderately priced and centrally located hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I won't be staying here again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: When we arrived we were told that the 1-bedroom suite we had booked was not available and that they had a studio for us at a reduced rate. The property in general was very poorly maintained. When using the bathtub for the first time, brown water came out of the tap! The bathroom sink leaked water onto the items we had to place below because there was no room for them anywhere else. There were areas of the room that appeared not to have been cleaned in quite some time, and some badly patched parts of the walls that looked as if someone had punched holes - perhaps as dissatisfied with their experience as we were? The pool was unusable, as it was covered with a thick green scum.

Reviews.Title: “Unpleasant experience for too high a price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: For less money, you can stay at a real hotel in the downtown area and actually get services, such as housekeeping, proper billing, and assistance with your luggage. La Tour Belvedere's description (and photos) on reservations.lodging.com is very deceptive: "The La Tour Belvedere is newly renovated with spacious furnished suites and fully equipped kitchens." If this flophouse has been "newly renovated" then I shudder to think about what it looked life BEFORE they renovated it. When we arrived we received no assistance with our luggage. The concierge (who was also the reservation clerk, bookkeeper, housekeeper, bellboy, hotel detective and switchboard operator) offered us no assitance with our luggage; not even the use of a wagon. "Da elevator's over dere. Here's ya key!" This guy also made several errors with our reservations during the weeks leading to our arrival. The "two bedroom" suite we were promised turned out to be a tiny room with 2 "beds": one bed was actually a convertible couch. The other a murphy bed that we had to pull out of the wall. When we pulled down the Murpht bed (no assistance offered by the Belvedere staff) we were horrified to discover that they hadn't even made the bed from the previous guest. The bed was difficult to pull down and had sharp metal edges that we kept cutting our feet on. There was a dim, flourescent light over the bed giving it that eerie, brothel look. We had top make our own bed with sheets that were scratchy and did not smell clean. There was no shampoo in the bathroom. On a positive note, the kitchen was large and serviceable. "The property is in a superb downtown location in a place of quiet, in the heart of Montreal's vibrant pleasure and business scene." Yes, it should be "quiet" since it is a good 30 minute walk (or 8 - 10 minute taxi ride) from anything. In fact, though, it was pretty noisy outside since it is in the middle of combination lower-middle class residental / small business (not shops) area. People were outside yelling after coming home from night shifts or an evening of drinking at local (non-tourist) hangouts. When I tried to call my own room from the airport to see if my girlfriend had arrived yet, the concierge/switchboard operator/reservation clerk tried to connect me. When there was no answer, I hung up. When my girlfriend called down to the hotel office later, to ask if there were any messages, she was told "yeah, your boyfriend called and said he will be here in 15 minutes." I left no such message. In fact I left no message. Since I had not even gotten on my plane to leave for Montreal, it would be hours before I arrived. After an hour passed and I still hadn't arrived, she called the hotel desk again, the concierge/hotel detective/housekeeper said "maybe something happened to him." My girlfriend was distraught !! She thought I died in a taxicab accident. We moved out this hole-in-the-wall the next morning, but they insisted on charging us for 2 days since we were checking out early. We checked into a Days Inn right in the middle of downtown for $22CAD a night less (and got full American breakfast and a swimming pool thrown in). The Days Inn room was almost twice the size, had daily room service, and all the amenities. WHAT WERE WE THINKING when we selected La Tour Belvedere ?!?!?!?

HotelInfo.Name: La Tour Belvedere
HotelInfo.Address: 2175 boulevard de Maisonneuve Ouest, Montreal, Quebec H3H 1L5, Canada
